subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 24 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - Man Utd v AC Milan
Man Utd host AC Milan in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final.



 
Ranson bids to take over Man City
Former Manchester City player Ray Ranson confirms his interest in buying the club.



 
We do not fear Milan - Ferguson
Man Utd boss Sir Alex Ferguson is confident ahead of Tuesday's Champions League match with AC Milan.








GOLF




Mickelson signs up coach Harmon
Phil Mickelson turns to swing coach Butch Harmon in a bid to improve the accuracy of his long game.



 
Muirfield seniors bow for Faldo
Nick Faldo will return to the scene of his 1987 and 1992 Open wins for his Seniors Tour debut in July.



 
Sorenstam loses number one status
Lorena Ochoa takes over as world number one from Annika Sorenstam.








MOTORSPORT




Raikkonen urged to get technical
Kimi Raikkonen's former team boss hints the Finn could be even better if he paid more attention to his role outside the car.



 
Pedrosa should be ready for China
Honda's Dani Pedrosa should be able to ride in the Chinese MotoGP despite crashing out in Turkey last weekend.



 
Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.








FORMULA ONE




Raikkonen urged to get technical
Kimi Raikkonen's former team boss hints the Finn could be even better if he paid more attention to his role outside the car.



 
Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.



 
BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.








ATHLETICS




Radcliffe not in GB marathon team
GB's marathon team for the World Athletics Championships is named but does not include Paula Radcliffe at this stage.



 
Yamauchi voices Osaka heat fears
Mara Yamauchi warns conditions in Osaka at the World Athletics Championships will be even tougher than during the London Marathon.



 
Runner dies after London Marathon
A 22-year-old runner who was taken ill after completing the London Marathon dies in hospital.








CYCLING




Basso suspended after new charges
Ivan Basso is suspended by his Discovery Channel team after being summoned to an Italian Olympic Committee doping hearing.



 
Landis anger at 'malicious' tests
Floyd Landis is 'infuriated' with US  anti-doping officials after his representative is excluded from the French laboratory testing his B samples.



 
Tour will snub dope-probe riders
Tour de France chief Christian Prudhomme says riders implicated in the Spanish doping scandal will not be welcome at this year's race.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Rafa Benitez on his Scouse daughter, plus Mick McCarthy and St Albans chant



 
Tuesday's gossip column
Real Madrid eye William Gallas, plus other rumours



 
Comment: Spot of bother for Jose
Robbo on Mourinho's claims of referees favouring Man Utd
